results.title: A Walk in the Sun
results.brief_description: Powerful and bold in its story, ‘A Walk in the Sun’ is unforgettable in its drama. The masterful director of “All Quiet on the Western Front” has again captured the deepest emotions of men at war.

results.title: A Walk in the park
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate discussion amount young people on the problem of drug abuse. It presents the momentary world to three young people, whose life style may appear rather unorthodox. The film presents non-moralizing, realistic episode open to a wide range of interpretations.

results.title: A Walk in the forest
results.brief_description: Based on an incident which occurred during oil exploration in Papua New Guinea. Two Australian geologists were working in an unknown area. After an argument with an old native woman, Boro, one of the natives on the survey fell sick with pneumonia. He believed she had put a curse on him. He had to be taken out of the jungle, by foot, canoe and eventually aircraft, and taken to hospital 300 miles away in Port Moresby.

results.title: A Walk in space
results.brief_description: The remarkable record of astronaut Edward White’s space walk from the Gemini IV space capsule. The films shows the earth one hundred miles below the ship and White’s manoeuvres while travelling 17,500 per hour outside the capsule.

results.title: A Voyage through the cosmos
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Adrian Malone, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In a spaceship of the imagination, we start a journey from a far-off region of the universe and gradually approach planet Earth. Dr Carl Sagan, our guide, manoeuvres the ship between galaxies of many kinds, near quasars and supernovae, through clouds of gas and dust from which future stars will be born, and past the planets to our own. Adapted from Cosmos the television series by Carl Sagan.

results.title: A Voyage round my father
results.brief_description: A successful barrister and keen amateur gardener, the headstrong and totally perverse Clifford Mortimer banged his head while climbing a tree and was blinded for life. For the next twenty years he refused to admit that anything had changed. His family had to pretend there was nothing wrong and life had to go on as normal. However, life became increasingly complicated and absurd. This is John Mortimer’s warm, witty portrait of his father and his family - filmed in the places where the events actually occurred. The scintillating dialogue and Laurence Olivier’s intensely accurate performance, brilliantly tease out the contradictions in this selfish, heroic man. Also stars Alan Bates and Jane Asher.

results.title: A Vous la France! [text]
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Brian Page
results.brief_description: Book to accompany videos. The course is an introduction to simple everyday French. The book contains the texts of all the conversations and interviews together with language notes, background information, quizzes, exercises and a handy reference section. It can be used on its own or in conjunction with the videos. Audio cassettes are also available.

results.title: A Vous la France! [kit]
results.brief_description: Two audio cassettes, Notes for teachers and a workbook to accompany the videorecorded course in French, A vous la France! Together they provide more structured reinforcement of the vocabulary introduced in the programs. The script of the programs is presented in the workbook with exercises and the Teacher’s notes give suggestions as to how best use the materials. The audio-cassettes give examples of correct pronunciation with opportunity to practise at intervals.

results.title: A vous de jouer, Monsieur Vidocq = Your turn Mr. Vidocq
results.brief_description:
Vidocq has an appointment with an old friend from Toulon. But by the time he arrives, his old friend is dead and the police holds Vidocq as the prime suspect.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Louis Arbessier, Marguerite Cassan, Claude Cerval.

results.title: A Voice to be heard
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Film Australia and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: In 1973 the National Aboriginal Consultative Committee (N.A.C.C.) was elected for the purpose of giving Aborigines a direct voice in the government. This was the first Australia-wide, elected and representative body of Aborigines in Australia’s history. This film, narrated by the Aboriginal poet Kath Walker, tells the story of the election up to the declaration of the poll and the first meeting of the N.A.C.C. Also takes a searching look at Aborigines as some of the candidates for election speak about their problems.
